intro: Anredera vesiculosa, commonly known as the bubble vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy, blister-like texture on the underside, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vigorous growth habit. Anredera vesiculosa is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, sometimes becoming invasive in certain regions.
